This #impeachment is nothing more than political posturing designed to undo the results of the 2016 election. The voters selected @RealDonaldTrump and will again in 2020!

Since day one of my swearing-in Democrats have been trying to impeach @RealDonaldTrump. This #Impeachment is purely political and inappropriate. Democrats need to accept the results of the 2016 election and move on.

(2/2) Democrats ran a partisan investigation refusing the rights of the minority refusing the ability for the president’s counsel to call witnesses refusing to allow the president’s counsel to cross examine fact witnesses & refusing a minority hearing day just to name a few.

(1/2) The process that has ensued in the House over the last few weeks was anything but open transparent bipartisan or equitable.  Abandoning all past historical due process afforded the minority AND the president.

(2/2) This is an attempt to impeach a duly elected president for asserting constitutionally based privileges that have been asserted on a bipartisan basis by administrations of both political parties throughout our nation’s history.
(1/2) The second Article Obstruction of Congress again doesn’t exist in the Constitution as a basis for impeachment.
Unlike Presidents Nixon and Clinton who were tried for actual crimes @realdonaldtrump is being impeached on vague phrases that appear nowhere in our Constitution.
The first Article of Impeachment you crafted is fiction and is NOT an enumerated basis in the Constitution for #impeachment.
First the Democrats went after the Russia collusion hoax then obstruction of justice then bribery then quid pro quo. None of which are included in these Articles before us today.
(3/3) The first day of this Congress on Day 1 a Democratic member of my class called for the impeachment of the president long before a call to the Ukraine!
(2/3) 19 minutes after the inauguration the Washington Post published a story headlined “The Campaign to Impeach President Trump has begun.”
(1/3) The campaign to impeach a duly elected president and overturn the will of 63 million American voters started 19 minutes after the @realdonaldtrump took the oath of office.
This #impeachment charade did not start with a whistleblower complaint.

I was sent to Congress to address real issues facing my constituents not to waste my time playing political games.    We should have spent the year focusing on addressing real issues not this impeachment charade.

Impeachment is supposed to be used cautiously to address serious crimes. Democrats rushed through #impeachment without even hearing evidence from the Minority and they came to their conclusion based on second-hand hearsay evidence.  Disgraceful.
There is bipartisan opposition to #impeachment. All Republicans in Congress and even some Democrats oppose it. This impeachment is a disgrace.
The bottom line is this: The Democrats’ push for #impeachment is an attempt to undo the results of the 2016 election. Democrats need to accept the outcome and move on.
(2/2) Every day we have wasted on #impeachment is a day we could have spent improving the country.

(1/2) Every day constituents ask me when we are going to get a particular bill passed and far too often I have to tell them that I simply don’t know because we have wasted so much time on an unnecessary #impeachment process.

Let me be clear: #impeachment is nothing more than a political vendetta. We could have spent the last several months working to fix problems facing everyday Americans but instead we wasted time on this charade.

Under H.R. 1 taxpayer dollars will be going to support entrenched politicians and political consultants who we don’t agree with or want to support.
Our tax dollars should go to funding our military and protecting American citizens not to promoting politicians we don’t even agree with. That’s why I’m voting no on H.R. 1.

H.R. 1 takes power away from voters and puts it in the hands of convicted criminals. The bill would strip voters of their 14th Amendment rights to limit the vote to people who haven’t been convicted of murder violent felonies or other serious crimes.
H.R. 1 is a slap in the face to our democratic system. This bill attacks the rights of the states and puts our election security at risk.
Under H.R. 1 there would be no checks and balances to prevent voter fraud and no penalties for ineligible individuals voting in error.

Same-day voter registration is a threat to our democratic process. When voters are allowed to register on the same day there is very little room to confirm identity and ensure they are voting in the correct election.
Every day personal data is at risk online. With H.R. 1 the democrats would add to this threat by requiring states to maintain online voter registration with no safeguards.

H.R. 1 would require that all states adopt an automatic voter registration system that would rely on the federal government for records. This could lead to thousands of registration errors and the registration of ineligible voters.
Don’t be fooled—H.R. 1 is legislation that has been designed to fund elect and maintain the Democratic majority all while ignoring states’ rights and wasting taxpayer dollars.
